name: Body-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat.
2. Place your arms by your sides with palms facing downward, providing support and balance.
3. Extend and lift your legs, keeping them straight, so that they are perpendicular to the floor.
4. Using your core and hip flexors, lift your torso off the mat, bringing your chest closer to your knees while keeping your legs straight and elevated.
5. Hold the top position briefly, engaging your abdominal muscles.
6. Slowly lower your torso back to the starting position while keeping your legs elevated.
7. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Body-Ups is an exercise that targets core strength by lifting the torso towards the knees while lying on the back with legs elevated.
